Prerequisites: ACG 3113 AND ACG 4401 WITH C OR BETTER.
Course Description:
PREREQUISITES:ACG 3113 AND ACG 4401 WITH C OR BETTER.
THIS COURSE INCLUDES AN EXAMINATION OF THE EXTERNAL AUDITOR'S PROFESSIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND FUNCTIONS IN TODAY'S INTERNATIONAL MARKETPLACE. THIS COURSE ADDRESSES AUDIT PLANNING, INTERNAL CONTROL EVALUATION, SUBSTANTIVE TESTING, AND REPORT GENERATION IN DETAIL.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major: STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO DISCUSS THE PROFESSIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES OF AUDITORS. STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO DISCUSS AND LIST THE PROFESSIONAL FUNCTIONS OF AUDITORS. STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO CONDUCT AN AUDIT PLAN. STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO EVALUATE AN INTERNAL CONTROL SYSTEM. STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO CONDUCT SUBSTANTIVE TESTS. STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO GENERATE NECESSARY AUDIT REPORTS.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
